publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3662# Helen Eadie: European Union Year for Disabled People—That the Parliament notes that 2003 will be the EU Year For Disabled People; recognises the challenges that lie ahead in tackling the major social and practical barriers that continue to confront people who have a disability, and considers that companies, voluntary organisations, non-departmental public bodies and the Scottish Executive should adopt mandatory criteria to ensure that projects supported by grants, charitable donations or other means are designed to remove barriers that prevent people with a disability from playing a full part in society. Supported by: Rhoda Grant*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Robin Harper*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Linda Fabiani*, Michael Matheson*, Brian Fitzpatrick*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Christine Grahame*, Trish Godman*, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Robert Brown*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Sarah Boyack*, Mr Murray Tosh*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Dr Richard Simpson*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Mr Gil Paterson*, Scott Barrie*, Elaine Smith*, Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Irene McGugan*, Margaret Jamieson*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Brian Adam*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Cathy Peattie*
S1M-3662# European Union Year for Disabled People (lodged on 28 November 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*

S1M-3662# Helen Eadie: European Union Year for Disabled People—That the Parliament notes that 2003 will be the EU Year For Disabled People; recognises the challenges that lie ahead in tackling the major social and practical barriers that continue to confront people who have a disability, and considers that companies, voluntary organisations, non-departmental public bodies and the Scottish Executive should adopt mandatory criteria to ensure that projects supported by grants, charitable donations or other means are designed to remove barriers that prevent people with a disability from playing a full part in society. Supported by: Rhoda Grant, Robin Harper, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Michael Matheson, Brian Fitzpatrick, Ms Sandra White, Christine Grahame, Trish Godman, Tommy Sheridan, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Robert Brown, Marilyn Livingstone, Nora Radcliffe, Sarah Boyack, Mr Murray Tosh, Dr Richard Simpson, Mr Gil Paterson, Scott Barrie, Elaine Smith, Fiona Hyslop, Donald Gorrie, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Irene McGugan, Margaret Jamieson, Brian Adam, Cathy Peattie, Mr Keith Raffan
